title: Airport Parking Experts Offer Advice To Greece Holidaymakers
text:
The situation in Greece has become even more serious over the past couple of days with banks closing and cash machines being empty. That has left holidaymakers heading to Greece very concerned with some thinking about cancelling their holiday.
A leading airport parking company that helps holidaymakers save money on airport parking through their comparison tool has issued new advice for people heading to Greece. Ukairportcarparks.co.uk has put together advice, tips and answers to the most common questions they have been asked.
The financial situation in Greece has caused thousands of UK holidaymakers worried about visiting the popular country. These worries include if they will have hotel accommodation when they arrive, if cash machines will be working, as well as what happens in an emergency. To answer these questions, Ukairportcarparks.co.uk has put together a list of popular questions and answers to help put holidaymakers minds at ease.
These questions include:
Should I be worried about my Greek Holiday?
Should I cancel my holiday in Greece?
Will my travel agent give me a refund if I wish to cancel my holiday in Greece?
Will my credit cards and debit cars work in Greece?
Will shops and restaurants accept my credit and debit card as payment?
Is Cyprus affected by the financial problems in Greece?
A spokesman for Ukairportcarparks.co.uk said: “We have been asked a lot of questions about travelling to Greece from our customers, so we decided to put on our blog a list of the most popular questions with the answers.”
Each year around 2 million people travel to Greece from the UK, but with the recent financial troubles tourist officials fear it will put people off from enjoying what they have on offer. High street travel agents have already reported a large number of Greek holidays are unsold and fear the trend will continue until the financial situation is resolved.
The questions and answers on Greece for holidaymakers can be found at http://www.ukairportcarparks.co.uk/blog/advice-for-holidays-in-greece
It is feared if tourists from the UK and other countries turn their back on Greece then it will have a huge knock-on affect on unemployment.
